description: Seventh storey addition (sixth floor); replacing access hatches to form habitable space for all fourth - fifth floor (fifth - sixth storey)  flats ( 4 no. x units); provision of balconies with associated balustrades to the front (western) elevation, additional windows to the rear (eastern) elevation
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: 16006 13 Proposed Site Plan, 1072-90 Existing Ground Floor Plans, 1072-91 Existing Fourth Floor Plans, 1072-92 Existing Fifth Floor Plans, 1072-93 Existing Roof Level Plans, 1072-94 Existing Elevation - W, 1072-95 Existing Elevation - E, 1072-96 Existing Elevation - N,S, 1072-97 Rooftop Access Section, 16006 04GA REV.02 As Approved Fifth Floor Plan, 16006 05GA 01 Proposed Sixth Floor Plan, 16006 07GA REV.04 Proposed West Elevation, 16006 08 GA REV.03 Proposed East & South Elevation, 16006 09 GA REV.01 Proposed Section A & D
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with the existing building and details indicated in the submitted application form and on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| A scheme for the storage of refuse and recycling shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The scheme as approved shall be carried out in full prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, to protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.

| A minimum of four (4) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in the ground floor of the building in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016).
